member.summary: Current user of the radio (C# or MAC objects)

member.summary: Constructor for 802.15.4 radio, specifying driver name and data

member.name: M:Samraksh.eMote.Net.Radio.Radio_802_15_4_Base.ReleaseMessage
member.remarks: Normally the packet's memory will be released during a subsequent GetNextPacket call. This method releases the memory immediately.

member.name: M:Samraksh.eMote.Net.Radio.Radio_802_15_4_Base.GetNextPacket
member.summary: Get the next packet from the radio driver.
member.remarks: The radio does not maintain a buffer so the onus is on the application to sample this data as quickly as possible on getting a receive interrupt. Otherwise the packet is overwritten in the radio layer. For buffer support use the MAC interface
member.returns: A data packet of message type to the caller

member.name: M:Samraksh.eMote.Net.Radio.Radio_802_15_4_Base.Initialize(Samraksh.eMote.Net.Radio.RadioConfiguration)
member.summary: Initialize native radio and interop drivers.
member.returns: The status after the method call: Success, Fail, Ready, Busy

member.name: M:Samraksh.eMote.Net.Radio.Radio_802_15_4_Base.Configure(Samraksh.eMote.Net.Radio.RadioConfiguration)
member.remarks: Used to change the Radio configuration during and after initialization, using this function can change the callback if a different callback is used. Please use reconfigure to change power and channel

member.summary: Set the transmit power of the radio

member.summary: Return the transmission power value of the radio

member.summary: Set the address of the device

member.name: M:Samraksh.eMote.Net.Radio.Radio_802_15_4_Base.PreLoad(System.Byte[],System.UInt16)
member.summary: Load the message into the transmit buffer of the radio.
member.returns: The result of the method: E_RadioInit, E_RadioSync, E_RadioConfig, E_MacInit, E_MacConfig, E_MacSendError, E_MacBufferFull, S_Success

member.summary: Send the message in the transmit buffer

member.name: M:Samraksh.eMote.Net.Radio.Radio_802_15_4_Base.SendTimeStamped(System.Byte[],System.UInt16,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Load and send a time-stamped message, with specified time stamp
member.remarks: The offset for the timestamp in the packet is specified by TimeStampOffset member of the RadioConfiguration structure passed as parameter during radio module initialization.
member.returns: The result of the method: E_RadioInit, E_RadioSync, E_RadioConfig, E_MacInit, E_MacConfig, E_MacSendError, E_MacBufferFull, S_Success
